title: [ENH] Mirror Jupyter notebooks using JupyText
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
A clear and concise description of what the problem is.

Sktime repository contains a lot of notebooks (https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/tree/main/examples). The problem that motivated me to write this issue is mainly bad experience with notebook review process based on https://www.reviewnb.com/. To my taste it is still very imprecise in comparison to pure text diff.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
A clear and concise description of what you want to happen, ideally taking into consideration the existing toolbox design, classes and methods.

- Create `.py` mirrors for each notebook in examples (https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/tree/main/examples) using "paired notebooks" (https://jupytext.readthedocs.io/en/latest/examples.html).
- Add pre-commit hook to sync all notebooks automatically with their plain text mirrors (https://jupytext.readthedocs.io/en/latest/using-pre-commit.html).

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.
